text.__SUMMARY__:
Euphorbia missurica, commonly called prairie sandmat, is a species of flowering plant in the spurge family (Euphorbiaceae). It is native to North America, where it is found primarily in area of the Great Plains. Its natural habitat is in dry, often calcareous areas, including glades, bluffs, and open woodlands.Euphorbia missurica is an annual. It produces small white flowers in late spring and early summer.
